agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Ways & Means TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, April 3, 2019 PLACE: JHR 140 CHAIR: Rep. Dustin Burrows HB 52 Hinojosa | et al. Relating to a franchise tax credit pilot program for taxable entities that contribute to an employee dependent care flexible spending account. HB 276 Miller Relating to a deduction under the franchise tax for certain contracts with the federal government. HB 710 Wray Relating to the computation of cost of goods sold for purposes of the franchise tax by taxable entities that transport ready-mixed concrete. HB 827 Rose Relating to the exemption from ad valorem taxation of an improvement that is necessary to support the continued use or existence of a historic site. HB 966 Dutton | et al. Relating to providing a sales and use tax refund or franchise tax credit for businesses that employ certain apprentices. HB 1607 Goldman | et al. Relating to a deduction under the franchise tax for certain contracts with the federal government. HB 1883 Bonnen, Greg Relating to deferred payment of ad valorem taxes for certain persons serving in the United States armed forces. HB 1885 Bonnen, Greg | et al. Relating to the waiver of penalties and interest if an error by a mortgagee results in failure to pay an ad valorem tax. HB 1923 Blanco Relating to the exemption from the franchise tax and certain filing fees for certain businesses owned by veterans during an initial period of operation in the state. HB 2111 Pacheco | et al. Relating to economic development, providing for an amendment to certain existing tax increment reinvestment zones to extend the duration of the zones. HB 2397 Clardy | et al. Relating to a sales and use tax refund and franchise tax credit for certain businesses that make investments in qualified opportunity zones. HB 2545 Guillen Relating to franchise tax, oil production tax, and gas production tax incentives for certain desalination facility operations. HB 2611 Morrison Relating to the treatment of certain limited liability companies as passive entities for purposes of the franchise tax. HB 2864 King, Tracy O. Relating to the E-Z computation of the franchise tax. HB 3006 Burrows Relating to the administration of the mixed beverage sales tax. HB 3475 Guillen Relating to the cigarette tax and the tax on cigars and other tobacco products; requiring permits. HB 3579 Burrows Relating to the calculation, collection, and remittance of state hotel occupancy taxes. HB 3754 Burrows Relating to the collection of local permit and license fees authorized under the Alcoholic Beverage Code; authorizing a fee. HB 3787 Sanford Relating to the application of the sales and use tax to certain property and services. HB 3823 Sherman, Sr. | et al. Relating to a paid family care leave incentive for certain employers. HB 3865 Bailes Relating to calculation of daily production for purposes of the oil and gas production tax credits for low-producing wells and leases. HB 4198 Murphy Relating to the exclusion from total revenue of certain payments made by a performing rights society for purposes of computing the franchise tax. HB 4614 Guillen Relating to the administration, collection and remittance of cigarette tax The order in which bills are heard is at the discretion of the Chair. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
